unnormalised: The Delhi Jal Board has announced revised water tariffs effective 01/04/2024. For households consuming up to 20,000 liters, the rate remains free. However, consumption between 20,001 and 30,000 liters will now be charged at Rs. 3.67 per 1,000 liters, a slight increase from the previous Rs. 2.77.
normalised: The Delhi J-A-L Board has announced revised water tariffs effective first April two thousand and twenty four. For households consuming up to twenty thousand liters, the rate remains free. However, consumption between twenty thousand and one and thirty thousand liters will now be charged at rupee three point six seven per one thousand liters, a slight increase from the previous rupee two point seven seven.

unnormalised: Consumers using between 30,001 and 50,000 liters will face a rate of Rs. 5.50 per 1,000 liters. For usage exceeding 50,000 liters, the charge will be Rs. 7.34 per 1,000 liters. These new rates are aimed at promoting water conservation and ensuring equitable distribution, especially during the peak summer months.
normalised: Consumers using between thirty thousand and one and fifty thousand liters will face a rate of rupee five point five zero per one thousand liters. For usage exceeding fifty thousand liters, the charge will be rupee seven point three four per one thousand liters. These new rates are aimed at promoting water conservation and ensuring equitable distribution, especially during the peak summer months.

unnormalised: The bill amount also includes a fixed service charge which varies based on the meter size. For meters of size 1/2 inch, the service charge is Rs. 115.62, while for 3/4 inch meters, it's Rs. 288.97. Consumers are advised to check their water bills and regulate their usage to avoid higher charges. Payment can be made online, or in person at designated centres before 15/05/2024 to avoid late payment penalties.
normalised: The bill amount also includes a fixed service charge which varies based on the meter size. For meters of size half inch, the service charge is rupee one hundred and fifteen point six two, while for three divided by four inch meters, it's rupee two hundred and eighty eight point nine seven. Consumers are advised to check their water bills and regulate their usage to avoid higher charges. Payment can be made online, or in person at designated centers before fifteenth May two thousand and twenty four to avoid late payment penalties.
